physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 170/106 mm Hg, 147/101 mm Hg; Heart rate: 140-150 bpm
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Notable for pedal edema, positive notching sign in uterine Doppler with umbilico-placental resistance above 95th percentile.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: On hospital day 4, blood pressure averaged 186/110 mm Hg, urine protein-to-creatinine ratio was 4.5, and sFlt-1 levels were 18,755 pg/mL.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 186/110 mm Hg; Heart rate: 130-160 bpm
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Notable for hypertension and edema; 24-hour urine collection revealed 6.4 g of protein.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure remained stable with values of 175/100 mm Hg; urine protein-to-creatinine ratio decreased after treatment.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 177/95 mm Hg; Heart rate: 140-160 bpm
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Notable for hypertension and pedal edema. Estimated fetal weight was 811 g.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By hospital day 7, sFlt-1 levels and urine protein-to-creatinine ratio climbed.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 140/107 to 182/120 mm Hg; Heart rate: average 130 to 150 bpm
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: During treatment, fetal heart rate decreased but recovered after normal saline infusion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No further reductions in blood pressure or fetal heart rate noted after treatment adjustments.
